French</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"1\" ind2=\"2\" tag=\"245\"><subfield code=\"a\">A matter of blue :</subfield><subfield code=\"b\">poems = Une histoire de bleu/</subfield><subfield Cornelio.</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"3\" ind2=\"1\" tag=\"246\"><subfield code=\"a\">Histoire de bleu</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\" \" ind2=\" \" tag=\"250\"><subfield ind2=\" \" tag=\"490\"><subfield code=\"a\">The Lannan translations selection series</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"0\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"505\"><subfield code=\"t\">We know love exists through hearsay --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">sea within us tries out sentences --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Sometimes one of us stands near the sea --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">On nice days, the open sea shimmers --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Blue's recovery after the downpour ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">\"There were some unusual clouds that year\" --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">\"The sky's substance is strangely tender\" --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Dark-eyed women have a blue gaze --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Do not think all this blue is without pain --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">In summer, in the evening ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">They move about --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Alive, they proceed hands first --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">sea is a picture book --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">They look at the blue, but will never know how to say it --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">They are sometimes seen beneath lampposts --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">He's heading out to sea is what they say of someone embarking on a journey ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">They leave their islands to go to sea --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">He picks up a pen or a paintbrush --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Orthodoxy of blue --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">For centuries, she's been beating --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">sea is the gods' vacancy --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Sometimes, it's only the light sound of forks against earthenware --</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"8\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"505\"><subfield code=\"t\">Soon there was nothing left of belief but the memory of its color --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Nothing remains but an empty gesture resembling prayer --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Sometimes words hurry --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Soul --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">There --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Blue makes no noise --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">All this blue is not the same ink --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">We don't know : we don't understand --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Blue increases and reproduces on the debris of our life --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">blue of the sky can do without our help --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Like a cloth, the sky soaks --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">blue around here blurs when night falls --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">There is nothing that can be locked up in a book --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">This blue belongs to no one --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">sea's masts are illusory --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Bugles, horses of the deep, mouth of the sea! --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">With my dulcimers, my trumpet and my timpani --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Here we strike the iron of the soul --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">man swimming there is an iodine and cobalt poem --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Unending narration of the open sea --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">So much light in tears --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">From all over, she flows --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">horizon of slate and slag --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">You there, the tiny body of a transfixed man ... --</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"8\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"505\"><subfield code=\"t\">You're soaking in dreams, you lose your foothold in yourself --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">White swimmer in the sea's arms --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Use this blue to compose --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Don't balk at the expense --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">You have blue at your fingertips --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">You burn with your sentences --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">And you there, smeared with cherries? --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">You were the bluest in your dress --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Nine days at sea as in a church --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">This blue sticks to my lips --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Start from nothing, emphasize this nothing --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">I've been putting words next to words for a long time --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">In language, I contemplate the blue of the sky --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">For me, writing is about departing --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">I cannot survive in the impossible --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Late in the autumn, when the rain falls with a soft noise ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Everything I've loved, everything I've lost ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Death falls asleep right against the sea --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Aluminum-colored fish wander in the sea's baggage holds --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Along the cliffs and beaches, the sea looks after our remains --</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"8\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"505\"><subfield code=\"t\">In the evening when it pulls back to leave all the room to darkness ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">edge of the world is quite near ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Broken old women move about all evening ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">heart of crushed glass --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">What kind of snow continuously falls ... --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Does the sky enjoy hearing this faint sound of a creaking heart? --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Emma liked blue --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Her dresses must be mentioned --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">When she loosens her dress, the man is silent --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">No one can express her desire --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">If you call her, she doesn't come --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">She sometimes remembers her childhood --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">So many days have passed .. --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Some say she once dreamed of evaporating --</subfield><subfield code=\"t\">Loves is what she calls these departing sailors and sailboats on the open sea ...</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"1\" ind2=\" \" tag=\"700\"><subfield code=\"a\">Cornelio, Dawn M.</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\" \" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"830\"><subfield code=\"a\">Lannan translations selection series.</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\" \" ind2=\" \" tag=\"901\"><subfield code=\"a\">R6521343</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\" \" ind2=\" \" tag=\"902\"><subfield code=\"a\">050915AB0701</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"1\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"904\"><subfield code=\"a\">United States</subfield><subfield code=\"b\">B O A Editions Ltd</subfield><subfield code=\"b\">Consortium Bk Sales Dst</subfield><subfield code=\"c\">2005</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"0\" ind2=\"0\" tag=\"905\"><subfield code=\"a\">A Lannan translation selection</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\" \" ind2=\" \" tag=\"906\"><subfield code=\"a\">Cloth ed. avail. USD 22.00 1-929918-66-6  Parallel English/French</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\"1\" ind2=\"2\" tag=\"909\"><subfield code=\"a\">A matter of blue :</subfield><subfield code=\"b\">poems = Une histoire de bleu /</subfield><subfield code=\"c\">by Jean-Michel Maulpoix ; translated from the French with an introduction by D.M. Cornelio.</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\" \" ind2=\" \" tag=\"980\"><subfield code=\"a\">20050913</subfield><subfield code=\"b\">15.95</subfield><subfield code=\"e\">1297</subfield><subfield code=\"f\">10354827</subfield><subfield code=\"g\">1</subfield></datafield><datafield ind1=\" \" ind2=\" \" tag=\"981\"><subfield code=\"a\">BNA</subfield><subfield code=\"b\">MODER</subfield><subfield code=\"c\">N LAN</subfield></datafield></record>"
        ],

marc_liberation.title: Introduces handling for case where Oracle DB query errors are raised while retrieving bib. IDs related to request IDs
Post a sample of records with location 'f'

comments.body: We will have to map the location 'f' to a different location in Alma since we cant configure our locations.
This is how the Locations Object looks like https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_locations.xsd/?tags=GET
we cannot configure yet the locations in Alma according to @mzelesky and @kevinreiss. we will ask exlibris in basecamp.

marc_liberation.title: Retrieve full availability using the Alma API

comments.body: We decided with the Alma group to break down this issue in different scenarios. This will help to improve the way we retrieve currently the availability.

the structure of the bib object: https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_bib.xsd/?tags=GET. 
 
`GET /almaws/v1/bibs/{mms_id}`
Adding expand=p_avail: will add an **AVA** (availability) tag in the record with the physical availability:
`https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/991129830000541?expand=p_avail`
will return: 
```
<datafield ind1=" " ind2=" " tag="AVA">
            <subfield code="0">991129830000541</subfield>   mms_id
            <subfield code="8">224687740000541</subfield>   holding_id
            <subfield code="a">01PRI_INST</subfield>  Institution code
            <subfield code="b">MAIN</subfield>  library value
            <subfield code="c">Stacks</subfield>  location desc
            <subfield code="d">292 H31m</subfield>  call_number
            <subfield code="e">available</subfield>  availability
            <subfield code="f">1</subfield>  total items               
            <subfield code="g">0</subfield>  non available items                               
            <subfield code="j">main</subfield>  Location code  
            <subfield code="k">8</subfield>  Call number type
            <subfield code="p">1</subfield>  priority  
            <subfield code="q">Main Library</subfield> library desc
        </datafield>

for an electronic title:
GET /almaws/v1/bibs/{mms_id}
Adding expand=e_avail: will add an **AVE** (availability) tag in the record with the electronic availability:
`https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/991946890000521?expand=e_avail`
```
<datafield ind1=" " ind2=" " tag="AVE">
            <subfield code="8">5310439700000521</subfield>  portfolio
            <subfield code="c">6110439730000521</subfield>  collection identifier for the electronic resource  
            <subfield code="e">Available</subfield>  activation status
            <subfield code="m">North East Research Libraries Nature Single Titles Plus</subfield>  Collection name
            <subfield code="s"> Available from 1869 volume: 1 issue: 1.</subfield>  coverage statement (as displayed in Primo's ViewIt mashup) 
            <subfield code="t">Nature</subfield>  Interface name  
            <subfield code="u">publishing_base_url undefined?u.ignore_date_coverage=true&rft.mms_id=991946890000521</subfield>
        </datafield>

From https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/bibs/R0VUIC9hbG1hd3MvdjEvYmlicy97bW1zX2lkfQ==/

AVA field is added per holding record (related to the input mms-id or to a related Bib records) as following: 
$$a - Institution code, $$b - Library code, $$c - Location display name, $$h - Campus, 
$$d - Call number, $$e - Availability (such as available, unavailable, or check_holdings), 
$$j - Location code, $$k - Call number type, $$f - total items, $$g - non available items, 
$$v - Calculated summary information, 
$$p - priority, $$0 - Bib record ID, $$8 - Holdings ID (of items on permanent location only), $$t - Holdings Information, $$q - library name.
AVA is added also for items in temporary location. For such items, $$8 (holding id) will not be added.

AVE field is added per portfolio, as following: 
$$l -library code, $$m - Collection name, $$n - Public note, $$u - link to the bibliographic record's services page, 
$$s - coverage statement (as displayed in Primo's ViewIt mashup), $$t - Interface name. 
$$8 - portfolio pid, $$c - collection identifier for the electronic resource, $$e - activation status. 
$$i - Available for institution, $$d - Available for library, $$b - Available for campus. 
Note: $$u will be created based on a Customer Parameter in the "Customer Parameters" mapping table (module: general): publishing_base_url.

We identified with @mzelesky that the availability of a specific item **misses** `sequence` and `on_reserve`. We use them in: https://github.com/pulibrary/voyager_helpers/blob/26166ac7e68bfce5d5326f11c0a05933f2b07880/lib/voyager_helpers/liberator.rb#L283

GET `/almaws/v1/bibs/{mms_id}/holdings/{holding_id}/items` This will retrieve the items list.

If we want Item and label printing information, use item_pid from the record. 
GET `/almaws/v1/bibs/{mms_id}/holdings/{holding_id}/items/{item_pid}`

The item_data also includes **barcode** information. https://developers.exlibrisgroup.com/alma/apis/docs/xsd/rest_item.xsd/#item
`barcode: The item's barcode.
If not sent as part of the PUT or POST actions, Alma will generate a barcode based on the barcode generation rules.`
Documentation for the order_status in Alma: https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/020Acquisitions/020Purchasing/030Searching_for_PO_Lines

In Alma we are able to customize the `availability` labels. for example an item which is checked out has a label `<base_status desc="**Item not in place**">0</base_status>`.
This will give us the ability to customize labels in Alma based on our needs and avoid some of the mapping we do on the front end (Orangelight).  
example :
`GET /almaws/v1/bibs/{mms_id}/holdings/{holding_id}/items`
`https://api-na.hosted.exlibrisgroup.com/almaws/v1/bibs/99222241506421/holdings/2281569980006421/items`

marc_liberation.title: Investigate partial bib record update functionality

comments.body: According to the API there is no "merging" of data into the record. The body of the PUT request has to be the full record. So we'd have to grab the whole record, update the 856, and PUT it back in (probably with appropriate optimistic locking checks and sidekiq retries).

We have a restricted number of API calls to Alma. In some cases we bulk complete hundreds or thousands of Figgy records at once, which will probably bump up against the concurrent API call request limit of 25/second. Do we know how many named users we have? The daily limit may be an issue too.
There are "normalization rules" that provide mutation commands for single properties in a record, but there's no API for them.

We may be able to build up an import profile as per https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/040Resource_Management/060Record_Import and do the 856s automatically on a nightly basis.
So I think we can create an OAI import profile with a custom merge rule to only copy over 856s.

Import Profile documentation: https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/040Resource_Management/060Record_Import/020Managing_Import_Profiles

Merge Rule Documentation:
https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/040Resource_Management/040Metadata_Management/080Working_with_Merge_Rules

There doesn't seem to be a way to have import profiles only merge and never create records, which is a major issue. If a record is deleted in Alma, but exists in Figgy, we have to make sure it doesn't recreate that record because it's trying to update the 856.
The functional requirements document has been updated with this information and as per @kelynch this issue is considered investigated. Closing it.
I believe it is possible to set the import to never create. We were exploring import profiles earlier in another group.
Yes, you're right. There's a "Upon no match, do not import" - we could use that.

this is the documentation for the order_status in Alma. https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Product_Documentation/010Alma_Online_Help_(English)/020Acquisitions/020Purchasing/030Searching_for_PO_Lines

check the Acq API, PO Lines `GET /almaws​/v1​/acq​/po-lines Retrieve PO-Lines`
based on the documentation `PO-Line Status. Optional. Valid values are CLOSED, CANCELLED, ACTIVE, ALL, ALL_WITH_CLOSED. Default: ALL (retrieves all PO lines except CLOSED).`

pul_library_drupal.title: Assets missing from some admin pages in prod only

comments.body: These errors are coming from attempting to [edit a user node](https://library.princeton.edu/user/3557/edit) or [adding a new basic page node](https://library.princeton.edu/node/add/page). This is likely some strange cache issue.

Tomorrow morning...
```
ssh pulsys@library-prod1
sudo mv production_files/css production_files/css_sav
sudo mv production_files/js production_files/js_sav
sudo mkdir production_files/css
sudo mkdir production_files/js
sudo chown www-data:deploy production_files/js
sudo chown www-data:deploy production_files/css
sudo su - deploy
cd /var/www/library_cap/current
drush vdel drupal_js_cache_files && drush vdel drupal_css_cache_files
drush cc all
```
